element.name: CRITERIA
element.documentation: Specifies this class's attributes are to be used in criteria queries.

element.name: ENTITY
element.documentation: Denotes this class is to be treated as a persistable entity.

element.name: SERVICE
element.documentation: Denotes this class represents a service that is implemented using the facade pattern.

element.name: FINDER_METHOD
element.documentation: Denotes this operation to perform a query on the underlying collection of entities, rather than execute business logic.

element.name: IDENTIFIER
element.documentation: Explicitly specifies this attribute to make up the entity's identifier (primary key)

element.name: UNIQUE
element.documentation: Denotes an attribute to be unique among all possible instances of the underlying entity.

element.name: VALUE_OBJECT
element.documentation: Denotes a class to be a simple class that is only holding values and providing accessors to them.

element.name: EXCEPTION
element.documentation: This class will instruct the generation of an exception class.

element.name: APPLICATION_EXCEPTION
element.documentation: This class will instruct the generation of a checked exception class.

element.name: UNEXPECTED_EXCEPTION
element.documentation: This class will instruct the generation of an unchecked exception class.

element.name: EXCEPTION_REF
element.documentation: Indicates that the target is an exception which is thrown by the method.

element.name: ENUMERATION
element.documentation: This class will instruct the generation of a type-safe enumeration class.

element.name: WEBSERVICE
element.documentation: Denotes a class to represent a collection of web service operations, similar behavior as a normal Service.

element.name: WEBSERVICE_OPERATION
element.documentation: Denotes an operation to be exposed as a web service.

element.name: NULLABLE
element.documentation: Indicates a service operation argument may be left unspecified (eg. Java null).

element.name: TRANSIENT
element.documentation: Indicates the attribute or association end should not be persisted/serialized.

element.name: MANAGEABLE
element.documentation: Only makes sense when there already is an Entity stereotype. Add this one to manage this entity through all 3 tiers.

element.name: FRONT_END_EXCEPTION
element.documentation: Modeled on a transition within a front-end process, it designates an exception occuring while processing an action.

element.name: FRONT_END_VIEW
element.documentation: This stereotype is modeled on an action state to denote it is representing a view on a front end (such as a JSP page).

element.name: FRONT_END_USE_CASE
element.documentation: A use-case that participates in the front-end (or presentation-tier) processes.

element.name: FRONT_END_APPLICATION
element.documentation: The use-case flagged with this stereotype will be the application's starting point, you can only use this stereotype in combination with the <<FrontEndUseCase>> stereotype.

element.name: QUEUE
element.documentation: The node flagged with this stereotype represents a Queue message destination (i.e. JMS, etc).

element.name: TOPIC
element.documentation: The node flagged with this stereotype represents a Topic message destination (i.e. JMS, etc).

element.name: DOC_ONLY
element.documentation: Modeled component is for documentation only. Do not generate code.

element.name: FUTURE
element.documentation: Modeled component will be developed in the Future. Do not generate code.

element.name: IGNORE
element.documentation: Modeled component should be ignored. Do not generate code.

element.name: ANALYSIS
element.documentation: Modeled component is part of an RUP analysis package. Do not generate code.

element.name: PERSPECTIVE
element.documentation: Modeled component is part of an RUP perspective package. Do not generate code.

element.name: MODEL_HYPERLINK
element.documentation: Represents a hyperlink within a model

element.name: EXTERNAL_HYPERLINK
element.documentation: Represents an external hyperlink (i.e. to an external website for example).

element.name: PERSISTENCE_SCHEMA
element.documentation: The name of the persistence schema that contains the table.

allowedValues.value: A string representing the name of the database schema where the entity will be persisted

element.name: PERSISTENCE_TABLE
element.documentation: The name of the table corresponding to this entity in the persistent store.

element.name: PERSISTENCE_COLUMN
element.documentation: The name of the column corresponding to this property in the persistent store.

element.name: COLUMN_UNIQUE_GROUP
element.documentation: The name of the unique constrain group that this unique attribute belongs

element.name: PERSISTENCE_FOREIGN_KEY_CONSTRAINT_NAME
element.documentation: The name of the foreign key corresponding to this relation in the persistent store.

element.name: PERSISTENCE_IMMUTABLE
element.documentation: Denotes this entity's property can only be set at construction time.

element.name: PERSISTENCE_ENUMERATION_MEMBER_VARIABLE
element.documentation: Specifies whether the enumeration attribute is defined as a member variable rather than a literal. This should only be set if the attribute is NOT a literal.

element.name: PERSISTENCE_ENUMERATION_LITERAL_PARAMETERS
element.documentation: Specifies the enumeration literal parameters which are passed to the appropriate constructor when created. The parameters are comma separated.

element.name: PERSISTENCE_ASSOCIATION_END_PRIMARY
element.documentation: Indicates whether or not the association end is considered "primary" used for things like indicating which side of a one-to-one association should get the foreign key.

element.name: ASSOCIATION_END_UNIQUE_GROUP
element.documentation: The name of the unique constrain group that this unique association end belongs

element.name: PRESENTATION_CONTROLLER_USECASE
element.documentation: The value should correspond to the use-case holding the activity graph which has this controller as its context. This is used when deferring operations to the controller. Please note that if your CASE tool supports setting the context of an activity graph you will not need to explicitly set this tagged value. This feature has been provided to support tool such as Poseidon that have only limited UML support. If you are a MagicDraw user you will not need to use this tagged value, instead assign the controller by right clicking on it and selecting "Assign...".

element.name: PRESENTATION_USECASE_ACTIVITY
element.documentation: For tools that do not allow the placement of activity graphs inside of a use-case you can use this tagged value to point to an activity graph, this will link them and denotes that the graphs specifies this use-case.

element.name: PRESENTATION_TABLE_COLUMNS
element.documentation: The collection will be displayed in scrollable tabular format. Each column in this table will be mapped to a property of the object type contained in the collection. So you will need to make sure all objects have accessor methods for the property you list in this tagged value. Properties are separated using a comma ','. More than one value maybe be assigned to this tag, all properties will correctly be resolved.
element.appliedOnElement: A collection type parameter going into an action state carrying the <<FrontEndView>> stereotype

element.name: PRESENTATION_IS_TABLE
element.documentation: A flag indicating whether or not a parameter should be considered a table. This must be set to true when you wish to display a list of simple types (such as strings) within a table.
element.appliedOnElement: A collection type parameter going into an action state carrying the <<FrontEndView>> stereotype

element.name: MANAGEABLE_DISPLAY_NAME
element.documentation: The column representing this entity,by default the first <<Unique>> attribute found is taken but you might want to specify another column yourself. This value is used when one entity has a foreign key to another one and you want to select the value of this foreign key from a combobox and you would like to see a more meaningful label for each option, if no <<Unique>> attribute is found the identifier is used, which isn't very helpful.

allowedValues.value: any column name present in this entity
the name of the identifier column
